intro: Craterostigma abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian rockrose, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring small, thick leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
